result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad T. Ridgeman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from Defendant requesting the detainer be lifted so he can enter ERP
Defendant's signed Acknowledgement of the Court's 2/9/17 order

The Court orders that:  Upon deposit of $200.00 and current address information the Defendant be released from custody on the above mentioned case.  The Defendant shall pay the remaining balance plus interest and $15.00 payment plan fee at the rate of $25.00/mo. commencing 11/03/2017.  Civil judgment and referral to WI DOR, if applicable, shall remain.  Any failure to comply with this payment order shall result in the re-imposition of the failure to pay sentence without further notice of hearing.

Reminder Notice--Final Notice
Criminal Case Settlement
with Elements attached

Case called at 1:03pm [MA]
Defendant Chad T. Ridgeman in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Defendant to serve 1 day in the Jefferson County Jail,WITHOUT Huber, to commence 9/10/16 at 4:00pm
--0 days sentence credit

--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443,  to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 9/28/16 and on the 28th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a   8 day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court determines that Mr. Ridgeman already has DNA on file.
recess: 1:27pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 10:16am. 
Defendant Chad T. Ridgeman in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that then-DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Ridgeman in 2008. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
Attorney Huebner requests that the case be scheduled for a change of plea and sentencing. 
recess 10:19am.
[post hearing/off-record Mr. Ridgeman verifies to the clerk that the Little River Court, Jefferson address remains current]

NEXT:  Plea/Sentencing on 8/30/16 at 1:00pm.
Status conference on July 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Case called at 2:48pm [mo]
Defendant Chad T. Ridgeman in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Defendant updates his address
Defendant verifies that the date of birth on Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
--Mr. Ridgeman indicates that he wishes to obtain counsel 



The Court requires $1000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
